summary: This is an email chain from July 2020 where Andy Kay forwards a message inquiring why former President Bill Clinton is not being interviewed or charged, citing a claim that Clinton made 32 plane trips to Jeffrey Epstein's island. The email appears to be forwarded to an unspecified recipient for attention.

persons.name: Andy Kay
persons.context: Sends an email on July 2, 2020, asking why former President Bill Clinton is not being interviewed or charged in relation to Jeffrey Epstein, citing a claim about 32 plane trips to Epstein's island.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.role: Former President of the United States
persons.context: Subject of inquiry in the email, where Andy Kay references an unverified claim that Clinton made 32 plane trips to Jeffrey Epstein's island and questions why he is not being interviewed or charged.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned indirectly as the owner of the island referenced in the email inquiry about Bill Clinton's alleged travel.

connections.description: Email claims Bill Clinton made 32 plane trips to Jeffrey Epstein's island, implying a social or travel association.

events.title: Email inquiry about Bill Clinton and Epstein
events.description: Andy Kay sends an email questioning why former President Bill Clinton is not being interviewed or charged, citing an alleged 32 plane trips to Jeffrey Epstein's island.

keyFacts: An email from July 2020 contains an inquiry about why former President Bill Clinton is not being interviewed or charged in relation to Jeffrey Epstein.
The email references an unverified claim that Bill Clinton made 32 plane trips to Jeffrey Epstein's island.
The document shows ongoing public speculation and questions about the extent of associations between high-profile individuals and Jeffrey Epstein.
